title: ASX slips; Westpac to take $341m H2 remediation hit
text:
Robert Guy

Australian stocks finished the day less than 1 point higher, with mining stocks and embattled logistics software supplier WiseTech among the day's best performers.

The S &P/ASX200 Index ended up 0.9 points at 6673.1 points, with miner Gold Road Resources the best performer in the benchmark with a 14 per cent gain on signs its Gruyere mine was progressing well and upbeat analyst commentary.

WiseTech was the second best performer, bouncing 8.7 per cent higher as the beleagured tech play hit back at criticism about its accounting, platform quality and customer service from research firm J Capital.

Nickel miner Western Areas rallied 4.3 per cent after a positive September quarter production report.

Among blue chip stocks, Telstra fell 1.1 per cent, Commonwealth Bank gained 0.4 per cent and Rio Tinto rose 0.4 per cent.

Westpac fell 0.2 per cent after revealing late in the session that cash earnings would take a $341 million hit in the second half due to its customer remediation program.
description: ASX dips; Westpac details remediation charges; WiseTech rejects second round of JCap claims; Alphinity's Andrew Martin on when to buy banks.
